image.altText: Israeli soldiers walk on grassy terrain.

props.synopsis: Israel's military actions in Gaza are acts of self-defence against Hamas and "other terrorist organisations", the legal advisor for Israel's foreign ministry says at the opening of the second day of hearings at the World Court.

title.children: Israel rejects claims of genocide levelled in United Nation's top court

image.altText: A jet aircraft shoots across the flight deck of an aircraft carrier at night.

props.synopsis: There has been a diplomatic dance going on as the West backs Israel and Iran uses its proxies across the region, but now Western superpowers have jets in the sky.

title.children: There has been a proxy war playing out, but now the UK and US have jets in the sky

image.altText: A woman with light brown hair looks close to tears.

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Scott Morrison's press secretary made an angry phone call to a Network Ten news executive after it aired an interview between Brittany Higgins and journalist Lisa Wilkinson, court documents have revealed.

title.children: Court documents detail expletive-ridden call from PM's office to Network Ten over interview with Brittany Higgins

image.altText: Wanted man Brisbane

props.synopsis: Police say the 30-year-old man is a potential risk to the community and is wanted in relation to "a number of weapon and criminal offences".

title.children: Police seek urgent assistance to find potentially 'armed, dangerous' man in Brisbane

image.altText: A boy with a hat on, smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Northern Territory boy Tristan Frank was last seen near Balgo in outback Western Australia in 2020. He hasn't been seen since.

title.children: Coroner hears scant details of why 14yo boy Tristan Frank has been missing for three years without a trace

image.altText: Two purple, concentric circles with a red line passing through it.

props.synopsis: Astronomers have discovered a surprising "signal" outside of our galaxy after analysing 13 years of data from NASA's Fermi Gamma-ray Space Telescope.

title.children: NASA astronomers detect high-energy 'signal' outside our galaxy in 'serendipitous discovery'

image.altText: Three people hold brooms as they sweep debris off the ground in front of a store.

props.synopsis: The national death toll from violent riots in Papua New Guinea has climbed to 22, with the remains of six people found in Port Moresby today.

title.children: Discovery of six bodies lifts death toll in PNG riots to 22

image.altText: David Warner walking away from a helicopter that delivered him to the Sydney Cricket Ground for a Sydney Thunder BBL game.

props.synopsis: Less than a week after his Test farewell at the Sydney Cricket Ground, David Warner was touching down on the hallowed turf after a hasty helicopter ride from his brother's wedding.

title.children: David Warner arrives via helicopter for Big Bash game at SCG

image.altText: A dingo sits on a sanddune

props.synopsis: The primary school-aged girl is in Gympie Hospital with multiple lacerations after being bitten by a dingo on her leg, the second attack recorded on the heritage-listed island this year.

title.children: Dingo bites young girl on the leg at K'gari (Fraser Island) in second attack for 2024

image.altText: Fast food worker

props.synopsis: The "14 and 9 months" minimum working age is a myth. So at what age can you start work in your state?

title.children: Think you know what the minimum working age is? You're probably wrong

image.altText: Man smiling

props.synopsis: The family of a man shot dead by police in New South Wales say they understand the actions taken by officers, but the incident exposes a failure within the systems designed to support people with mental illness.

title.children: Family of man shot by police in Nowra say mental health system failure contributed to his death

image.altText: James Marape and members of his government

props.synopsis: Social and political tensions were rising across Papua New Guinea, then police went on strike and the streets ignited with deadly unrest, but the prime minister is claiming it was "political influence" that lit the match.

title.children: When the PNG PM appeared with 26 colleagues by his side, there was a clear message

image.altText: A rock carving of legs.

props.synopsis: Despite surveillance cameras put in place after vandalism in late 2023, rock carvings that are thousands of years old at the Bulgandry Aboriginal Art site have been deeply scratched to make them stand out.

title.children: Aboriginal art site vandalised for the second time in 6 months by potentially 'well-intentioned' visitors

image.altText: A snake peeking out from bed sheets

props.synopsis: A woman in her 20s is recovering after being bitten in her bed on a rural property in Queensland by what is thought to have been an eastern brown, the world's second most dangerous snake.

title.children: Emergency crew shares image of 'terrifying' snake in woman's bed after it bit her when she was asleep

image.altText: Two unidentified officers look out from the bridge of the ship

props.synopsis: A Houthi official says raids have been conducted in several Yemeni cities, including the capital Sana'a, with a US official saying strikes against the Iran-backed group were carried out by air and sea.

title.children: Deputy PM confirms Australia is providing support in US and British strikes against Houthi targets in Yemen

image.altText: A man sitting in his lounge room watching his younger self on TV.

props.synopsis: When George Isbester appeared on a 1980s television dating show, he never imagined it would later lead to him finding his wife on the other side of the world.

title.children: Perfect Match helped them find each other 31 years ago. Now they're facing their greatest challenge

image.altText: Water sitting in a dam with green grass around it.

props.synopsis: A prominent water engineer says a decision to abandon and rebuild the controversial Paradise Dam near Bundaberg would take years but is ultimately the "right choice".

title.children: Ever heard of a dam being built on a dam? Queensland is about to do it

image.altText: A group of people sit facing a court in a large, high-ceilinged historical building.

props.synopsis: A continent away from the war in Gaza, South Africa accused Israel of committing genocide against the Palestinians and pleaded with the United Nations’ top court on Thursday to urgently order a halt to the country’s military operation.

title.children: South Africa accuses Israel of committing genocide in Gaza in landmark International Court of Justice case

image.altText: Soldiers in green camouflage uniforms and holding rifles frisk two men up against a colourful brick wall.

props.synopsis: The brazen gang violence gripping Ecuador has shocked the world, but it's a familiar story in other countries across Latin America, where the shifting tides of the drug war have brought conflict to places previously thought peaceful.

title.children: Surging gang violence across Latin America is now affecting countries previously viewed as safe havens

image.altText: A composite image of Naomi Osaka and Caroline Wozniacki.

props.synopsis: Former Australian Open champions Caroline Wozniacki, Angelique Kerber and Naomi Osaka are all returning to Melbourne Park after having children.

title.children: Working two jobs and maybe missing milestones: Aus Open champs return after having kids

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers speaks to 7.30 after inflation hits two year low

props.synopsis: The government is happy to declare the inflationary benefits of some of its policies but is tight-lipped about the effect of the stage three tax cuts.

title.children: Will the stage three tax cuts worsen inflation? The government remains tight-lipped

image.altText: Northern Territory frontbencher Nicole Manison stands on the balcony of the fifth floor of NT Parliament.

props.synopsis: Ms Manison, who served as the NT's deputy chief minister for seven years, has announced she will not recontest her seat at the upcoming NT election in August.

title.children: Former NT deputy chief minister Nicole Manison to quit politics at next election

image.altText: A white ute driving on a road next to a homemade road sign

props.synopsis: A monsoon trough has brought heavy rain to regions still sodden after ex-Tropical Cyclone Jasper.

title.children: Fears heavy rains could hamper recovery in regions still reeling from ex-Tropical Cyclone Jasper

image.altText: A man and a woman run across a green oval near sprinklers

props.synopsis: Humidity has been at unbearable levels, with simmering waters and moist winds contributing to the warmth across eastern Australia.

title.children: When can eastern Australia expect relief from its higher-than-normal humidity levels?

image.altText: Man stands in front of canvas and paints.

props.synopsis: Artist Peter Lawson has travelled the world selling his paintings, and says it all began with a stroke of inspiration from his great-uncle and famous Australian poet Henry Lawson.

title.children: Great-nephew of Australian poet Henry Lawson describes 'inspiration' behind his own 60-year artistic career

image.altText: Lai Ching-te smile s and waves in a crowd of people waving rainbow flags

props.synopsis: Taiwan will go to the polls this weekend to elect a new government, and while the campaign has been fraught with chaos and Chinese influence, voters have other concerns on their minds.

title.children: How Taiwan's election could serve as a proof of concept for Chinese democracy

image.altText: Full photo of Farquharson family grave, taken from one side.

props.synopsis: Robert Farquharson, who killed his three sons, is the first convicted killer or serious criminal to have his rights to control the graves of his children taken away.

title.children: Killer Robert Farquharson's name has been chiselled off his sons' graves. Now he's lost the right to control them

image.altText: A woman with braids stands half in a denim shirt against a grey backdrop.

props.synopsis: The UK's Advertising Standards Authority rules that the 2023 ad campaign presented musician FKA Twigs as a "stereotypical sexual object".

title.children: The UK banned a Calvin Klein ad featuring a semi nude FKA Twigs. Now the musician is speaking out

image.altText: John Millman looks up

props.synopsis: One-time Roger Federer slayer and US Open quarterfinalist John Millman plays his last professional tennis match.

title.children: Tearful John Millman retires after losing Australian Open qualifying

image.altText: A woman stands smiling in a shirt that says worlds ugliest lawn. Her lawn has patches of grass, dirt and holes dugs by wildlife.

props.synopsis: Kathleen Murray's journey to claiming the World's Ugliest Lawn began in 2016 — when her ex took the lawnmower and some bandicoots decided to make it their own personal Disneyland.

title.children: Tasmanian winner of 'World's Ugliest Lawn' competition says her ex left with the mower
